title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:00): And it has to be the same ad the server side one.  
vmassol - (00:00): yes that's the nice part of GWT, it'll generate js version of your java objects  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:00): Oooh nice, got to look at that.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:01): So much code, this is why we need sandboxing.  
vmassol - (00:01): we have that already  
vmassol - (00:01): again  
vmassol - (00:01): :)  
vmassol - (00:01): it's what we call the "public api"  
vmassol - (00:02): what we should do though  
vmassol - (00:02): is ensure somehow that all entry points can only use it  
vmassol - (00:02): right now it's only a best practice  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:02): Currently nothing is in that sandbox.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:03): First thing we can do is make the XE xar pages author be XWikiGuest so they don't all have PR by default.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:03): Then \_something\_ will be in the sandbox :)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:05): I suppose we could register a "core" component with the component manager which put an api between things like storage and rights and everything else.  
vmassol - (00:07): CalebJamesDeLisl: it's good to see your enthousiasm to improve all things xwiki :)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:08): Thanks. We have the flexabulity now. If we can get security (be default, not be fixing all (known) bugs) and we can get speed, then we will be the best thing out there by far.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:08): s/be/by  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:09): I am quite intrigued by the idea of making everything secure at once rather than by laborious code review.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:10): I suspect there will be a lot of chatting to come before we have a coherent proposal.  
vmassol - (00:10): yes  
jvdrean left at 00:10 (Quit: Leaving.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:11): I like automation of tests, and it seems natural that security should be automated as well.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:12): Not sure if you're interested in the security paper, but I'm interested in sharing the link :)  http://cr.yp.to/qmail/qmailsec-20071101.pdf  
vmassol - (00:13): thanks, not sure I'll read it anytime soon though :) Got to go now. Thanks for the discussion! :)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:14): Thank you.  
vmassol left at 00:15 (Quit: Leaving.  
Denis left at 00:19 (Quit: Leaving.  
anamarias left at 00:31 (Quit: anamarias  
lucaa - (00:51): mmh, I just noticed that all xdialog-modal-container elements survive after they're used they're just switched to display:none  
lucaa - (00:52): for example when you delete comments, all the confirmation boxes remain in the document, only with display: none. Is this by design?  
sdumitriu - (00:52): Yep  
sdumitriu - (00:52): Bug  
lucaa - (00:52): ok  
sdumitriu - (00:52): Actually, no  
sdumitriu - (00:52): It's complicated  
sdumitriu - (00:52): You can call replace() on a notification  
sdumitriu - (00:53): To insert another one in its place  
sdumitriu - (00:53): Hm, I'll have to look at it someday  
lucaa - (00:53): yes, it's what I thought, that I use it wrong on annotaitons  
lucaa - (00:53): and I should replace instead of recreating a new one  
lucaa - (00:53): but then I tested the comments and I saw that it's the same

gvallarelli - (13:52): just an off-thread question(not related to XWiki)  
gvallarelli - (13:52): I've added this question to my GSoC proposal "Why we should take YOU?"  
gvallarelli - (13:53): and this my answer: Because I consider myself a determined person who wants to achieve challenging goals. Working for Jalview can improve myself, stretching both my social and technical skills.  
gvallarelli - (13:53): it's a good answer?  
lucaa - (13:56): jvelociter: is it me or in the new import there's no way to download an archive in the list of attached .xars?  
vmassol - (13:59): gvallarelli: not very good IMO  
vmassol - (14:00): everyone can say that  
vmassol - (14:00): you need to prove why they should take you  
vmassol - (14:00): ie show something tangible  
vmassol - (14:00): something you've done in the past  
vmassol - (14:00): that proves your points  
gvallarelli - (14:00): and to my proposal I've linked some source code  
vmassol - (14:00): ok that's good  
gvallarelli - (14:01): maybe some egoless?  
gvallarelli - (14:01): :)  
vmassol - (14:01): yes  
vmassol - (14:01): rather than showing how it'll improve you  
vmassol - (14:01): show how it'll improve the project  
gvallarelli - (14:01): you're right  
gvallarelli - (14:02): thanks vincent for your feedback  
gvallarelli - (14:02): :)

vmassol - (15:11): mflorea: found this existing issue: http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-4728  
vmassol - (15:11): could it be a duplicate?  
vmassol - (15:12): mflorea: can I also consider http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-4567 as fixed ?  
vmassol - (15:12): I'll close that one  
mflorea - (15:13): vmassol: yes, you can close XWIKI-4567  
vmassol - (15:13): I'll let you handle 4728  
mflorea - (15:16): XWIKI-4728 seems to be a duplicate indeed, of XWIKI-5066  
mflorea - (15:16): I'm not sure which one to keep open..  
vmassol - (15:17): you choose  
vmassol - (15:17): :)  
mflorea - (15:17): :)  
mflorea - (15:18): you changed your commit log in the end, right? so right now there's no commit bind to XWIKI-5066  
vmassol - (15:18): yes  
mflorea - (15:20): I'll close 5066 then, to keep Ludovic notified of the 4728 (he might need it for client projects)  
vmassol - (15:20): ok as you wish

bblfish - (17:33): we have bill gates on webid now...  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 17:43  
sdumitriu - (17:56): Reminder: vote for the XWiki.org logo  
sdumitriu - (17:57): Q: Do we declare a winer directly, or, given that the situation is pretty tight, and there is no clear winner on all vote counting methods, we make a second round, limiting to 4-5 options, and only one whole +1 per person?  
vmassol - (17:58): sdumitriu: no direct winner  
vmassol - (17:58): IMO  
tmortagne - (17:58): same for me  
sdumitriu - (17:58): +1  
tmortagne - (17:58): there should be another run  
sdumitriu - (17:58): OK, so it's settled  
sdumitriu - (18:00): Delay until monday, or one full week, so that people prepare a more thorough logo proposal, with light/dark backgrounds, grayscale + black/white versions, 16x16 ico, "powered by" button  
bblfish - (18:02): We have Bill Gates!!!! http://webid.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/XWikiAllGroup  
bblfish - (18:03): ;-)  
jvelociter - (18:05): yeah !
